paper_abstract: A strong alliance in a graph G = (V, E) is a set of vertices S subset of V satisfying the condition that, for each upsilon is an element of S, the number of its neighbors, including itself, in S is greater than the number of those neighbors not in S. A strong alliance S is global if S forms a dominating set of G. In this paper, we shall propose a way for finding a minimum global strong alliance for each of those Sierpinski-like graphs. Furthermore, we also derive the exact values of those global strong alliance numbers.
paper_title: Global Strong Defensive Alliances of Sierpinski-Like Graphs
